text:
*<!channel> *<#C010J0503QD|proj-testing-kits> team is in the ideation phase of potentially building a covid-19 test kit - _*Made in Ethiopia*_ :flag-et:.

We would like to gather some information to build a solid team for this. We will need to brainstorm and determine the feasibility required to build this in a timely fashion.

Kenyans have<https://twitter.com/KEMRI_Kenya/status/1247837553765613570/photo/1| built their own testing> and we could learn from what they have done.

Please answer the questions in the form if you are a medical doctor, laboratory technician, have any experience with biomedical equipment, virology, skills with usability testing, biochemistry, biology, biomedical sciences with lab experiences.
Please share the link to the form with anyone who would be interested in this project and can dedicate the time required to build it.

We will set up the meeting after reviewing the responses we receive.

Link to google form - <https://forms.gle/FG5J5Hwgq8fAzdZa9>

<@U0101KKMPFC> <@U010P2VU7ND> <@U010ZJYV6AU> <@U010986778X> <@U010H9HHT4M> <@UV8F3SRGA> <@U0102QX78GH>

'New tech at Kemri to enable Kenya to mass test for virus'

<https://twitter.com/KEMRI_Wellcome|@KEMRI_Wellcome> <https://twitter.com/IDeAL_KEMRI_WT|@IDeAL_KEMRI_WT> <https://twitter.com/veclab_KEMRI_WT|@veclab_KEMRI_WT> <https://twitter.com/MOH_Kenya|@MOH_Kenya> <https://twitter.com/SpokespersonGoK|@SpokespersonGoK> <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVE1gMcU8AAJBnJ.jpg>

attachments.title: EthioCovid19 Response Team: Test Kit Volunteer form
attachments.text: The Ethiopia COVID-19 Response Team (ECRT) is a global volunteer team of engineers, doctors, designers, marketers, architects, product managers, and other industry professionals. We have mobilized to build and support over 15+ open source projects to combat COVID-19. We are asking for your help in creating a COVID-19 test kit to be built in Ethiopia to mitigate the current shortage enable and aid in the fight against the pandemic. Please fill out the questions below. If you do not have experience in any of the methods currently on this list, please add your expertise in the "Other" box at the end of the form. Finally, please share with anyone who you think might be interested. Stay safe--thank you.
attachments.fallback: Google Docs: EthioCovid19 Response Team: Test Kit Volunteer form

Please share the link to the form with anyone who would be interested in this project and can dedicate the time required to build it.

text: <@U010787AZ2T> I can link you to Eka Kotebe and St. Peter right away and the other quarantine centers can find contacts.

text:
<@U0107JERE9L> :raised_hands: :fire: good start 
I wanted to understand the objective 
Is your plan to work on rapid test kit or make the already existing machines fit for testing ?or something diffrent so I can recommend the experts accordingly

For a start you should reach out to   
 EPHI / Pastor/*- rsearch and test center 
 The Ethiopian Medical Laboratory Association (EMLA)- technical
Ethiopian Pharmaceuticals Supply  Agency ( EPSA)  - to know number and type 
 Ethiopia medical association (EMA)
Ministry of  innovation and technology :- for the space and techincal support biomedical engineers etc
I believe these would be the right partners to have and also you can easily do  need assessment on 
- Machine type they have in the region :- Good news we have good number of machine that test for HIV/Aids , TB and viral with the right reagent.
- The number of machine so you can estimate how many could be done if it repurposed. 
-There is the GeneX machine for sure  but for the other brand I will have to check

From the article posted above , I didn't get the innovation part but rather the repurposing of the machine which Ethiopian MoH / medical association thought already about  or  have looked into after the Kenya innovation ? :grimacing: 
Anyway the  reagent now available doesn't fit the machine. If of course if one  buys it from the company like  the Kenyans mentioned then it potentially could work??- question is if there is enough supply from the manufacturer or is the result :100:
I have to find the research paper:point_up: and also discuss with some counterparts and how to proceed.
I understood that the kenyan have designed the virus transport medium using the big machines that are currently in use in various laboratories across the country are known as Polymerase Chain Reaction machines (PCR).I will add once I find out more.
Now the kenyans  are working on rapid Test ( in general Rapid test is still debatable if it would give false postive or negative ) 
Did anyone reach out to the Kenyan group? It could be open source info maybe ?
I hope this is a start and ask some technical ppl to join the effort

good start 
I wanted to understand the objective 
Is your plan to work on rapid test kit or make the already existing machines fit for testing ?or something diffrent so I can recommend the experts accordingly

For a start you should reach out to

I believe these would be the right partners to have and also you can easily do  need assessment on 
- Machine type they have in the region :- Good news we have good number of machine that test for HIV/Aids , TB and viral with the right reagent.
- The number of machine so you can estimate how many could be done if it repurposed.

From the article posted above , I didn't get the innovation part but rather the repurposing of the machine which Ethiopian MoH / medical association thought already about  or  have looked into after the Kenya innovation ?

Anyway the  reagent now available doesn't fit the machine. If of course if one  buys it from the company like  the Kenyans mentioned then it potentially could work??- question is if there is enough supply from the manufacturer or is the result
I have to find the research paper

and also discuss with some counterparts and how to proceed.
I understood that the kenyan have designed the virus transport medium using the big machines that are currently in use in various laboratories across the country are known as Polymerase Chain Reaction machines (PCR).I will add once I find out more.
Now the kenyans  are working on rapid Test ( in general Rapid test is still debatable if it would give false postive or negative ) 
Did anyone reach out to the Kenyan group? It could be open source info maybe ?
I hope this is a start and ask some technical ppl to join the effort

text:
Hi guys, Kisanet here.
I and my partner have developed a platform that was first intended to connect farmers and consumers, but now with the situation, we have customized deamat for everyone to use it without having to go the market. For now, we have launched in Mekelle, we hope to do the same in all cities soon.
 <https://deamat.com/>

attachments.title: Deamat . Shop African
attachments.text: Buy and sell vegetables, fruits, herbs, cereals, enjera, meat, chicken, crops, and everything else on Deamat.

elements.text:
Hi guys, Kisanet here.
I and my partner have developed a platform that was first intended to connect farmers and consumers, but now with the situation, we have customized deamat for everyone to use it without having to go the market. For now, we have launched in Mekelle, we hope to do the same in all cities soon.

text:
Hello all:slightly_smiling_face:,

Im here representing my team, we have developed an application to fight against the Covid-19 and we competed on <https://theglobalhack.com/|Global hacks> and im happy to say we made it to the finals,

To explain the App in easier way, the App tracks symptom from users and the symptom data will be processed and put on the map so users can see which areas are symptomatic, in addition by user permission we can track the location of the user in real time so they can see which area are densely visited by symptomatic people and wether they should avoid the route or not. this will also help Gov't to boost the testing process by tracking people who come in contact and identify quickly as a result save lives.

We have seen  <https://youtu.be/rRDr6dUTjbU|such app> in south korea and singapore, how they can be effective to help flatten the curve. and we need every support we can get to make it reality in our country. i have put links below please check them out and talk to me in direct message.

thank you,

Demo: <https://youtu.be/CFX1-bXLhTc>
Webpage: <https://www.a2sv.org/>

attachments.title: Home | The Global Hack
attachments.text: Global hack is the biggest online hackathon in the world fighting off the crisis to battle the problems we are facing as a global society after the immediate corona crisis is over. We are bringing together world class mentors and globally talented teams to build the solutions for the better future. Together.

text:
Thanks Ruth. This is a kick-off data gathering to create a team to discuss the things you have mentioned. There are a few people who have the expertise and are looking into what material is available in Ethiopia and what we can learn from the Kenyan team. However, it is too early in this process to have a definitive path.

I don't know anyone from the associations you listed or from the Kenyan team.

If you know anyone that can contribute to the initial discussion of feasibility and best practices, please share the google form with them. <https://forms.gle/FG5J5Hwgq8fAzdZa9>

attachments.title: EthioCovid19 Response Team: Test Kit Volunteer form
attachments.text: The Ethiopia COVID-19 Response Team (ECRT) is a global volunteer team of engineers, doctors, designers, marketers, architects, product managers, and other industry professionals. We have mobilized to build and support over 15+ open source projects to combat COVID-19. We are asking for your help in creating a COVID-19 test kit to be built in Ethiopia to mitigate the current shortage enable and aid in the fight against the pandemic. Please fill out the questions below. If you do not have experience in any of the methods currently on this list, please add your expertise in the "Other" box at the end of the form. Finally, please share with anyone who you think might be interested. Stay safe--thank you.

elements.text:
Thanks Ruth. This is a kick-off data gathering to create a team to discuss the things you have mentioned. There are a few people who have the expertise and are looking into what material is available in Ethiopia and what we can learn from the Kenyan team. However, it is too early in this process to have a definitive path.

I don't know anyone from the associations you listed or from the Kenyan team.

If you know anyone that can contribute to the initial discussion of feasibility and best practices, please share the google form with them.
